-  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The error message for unknown RDP errors (including 516) does not include the server name, making it harder to diagnose. The current implementation of RdpErrorCodes.GetError does not receive the hostname.\nApproach: Modify `RdpErrorCodes.GetError` to accept `hostname` as a parameter, update `Language.RdpErrorUnknown` in `Language.resx` to include `{0}` for the hostname in its format, and pass the `connectionInfo.Hostname` from `RdpProtocol.cs` to `RdpErrorCodes.GetError` in the `RDPEvent_OnFatalError` method."
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The error message for unknown RDP errors (including 516) does not include the server name, making it harder to diagnose.    "body_snippet": "I was able to create the SQL db just fine and can map to it from mRemoteNG, but when I import and save the connections I get errors.\r\n\r\n![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73240375/96735080-cb26ee80-1380-11eb-8859-8c43645a931d.png)\r\n\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\nI would assume it should be saving the connection information up to SQL.\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nErrors instead of saving. \r\n\r\n## Possible Solution\r\n<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix/reason for the bug, -->\r\n<!--- or ide...",

+      "description": "The user is reporting an error when saving to SQL. Adding more specific error logging will help diagnose the root cause of the issue when `dataAdapter.Update(dataTable)` fails."
+    }

   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDcyMDkyMTk2NA==",
@@ -124,5 +131,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-21T12:06:48Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The user is reporting an error when saving to SQL. Adding more specific error logging will help diagnose the root cause of the issue when `dataAdapter.Update(dataTable)` fails.\nApproach: Enhance error handling in `SqlDataProvider.cs` by wrapping `dataAdapter.Update(dataTable)` in a `try-catch (Exception ex)` block for general exceptions, logging the exception details, and re-throwing to ensure the original error is not masked. This will be done for MSSQL, MySQL, and ODBC data providers within the `Save` method."
 }

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/RDP/RdpProtocol.cs b/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/RDP/RdpProtocol.cs
index dc1c134ad..981f5c530 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/RDP/RdpProtocol.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/RDP/RdpProtocol.cs
@@ -1513,6 +1513,7 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.Connection.Protocol.RDP
             const int UI_ERR_NORMAL_DISCONNECT = 0xB08;
             const int UI_ERR_NLA_NOT_ENABLED = 0xB09;
             const int UI_ERR_CONNECT_FAILED_DOWN = 0x1807;
+            const int DISCOREASON_LICENSING_FAILED = 0x808; // 2056 — RDP licensing protocol error
 
             if (discReason != UI_ERR_NORMAL_DISCONNECT && _extendedReconnectAttemptsRemaining > 0)
             {
@@ -1549,6 +1550,13 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.Connection.Protocol.RDP
                 {
                     reason = "The connection failed. This may be due to a domain trust issue or NLA settings. Please check your domain trust relationship and NLA settings.";
                 }
+                else if (discReason == DISCOREASON_LICENSING_FAILED)
+                {
+                    reason = $"The connection to {connectionInfo.Hostname} was terminated due to an RDP licensing protocol error (code 2056). " +
+                             "This typically means the server has run out of Remote Desktop Client Access Licenses (RD CALs) " +
+                             "or there is a licensing configuration issue on the server. " +
+                             "Please contact your server administrator.";
+                }
 
                 Event_Disconnected(this, reason, discReason);
             }
